holidays.name: National Texas Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the unique culture, history, and spirit of the Lone Star State.
holidays.origin: Established to honor Texas' independence and rich heritage, this day embraces Texan pride across the nation.
holidays.funFact: Texas is so big that it would be the 10th largest country in the world if it were independent!

holidays.name: Crayon Day
holidays.description: A colorful day honoring everyone's favorite waxy coloring tool, the crayon!
holidays.origin: March 29 marks the anniversary of Crayola crayons' patent, celebrating creativity and childhood fun.
holidays.funFact: The first box of Crayola crayons had only 8 colors, but now they have over 120 shades!

holidays.name: National Mom and Pop Business Owners Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize and support small, local family-run businesses.
holidays.origin: Created to highlight the importance of small business owners and encourage community support.
holidays.funFact: Small businesses create about 1.5 million jobs annually in the U.S., making a huge impact on the economy!

holidays.name: Malaria Day
holidays.description: An observance to raise awareness about malaria prevention and the fight to eradicate this deadly disease.
holidays.origin: March 29 has been used by various organizations to highlight progress in malaria research and prevention.
holidays.funFact: Malaria kills over 400,000 people annually, mostly children under 5 in sub-Saharan Africa.
